Detailed Description

Class to create a client stream connection.

This is a base class for creating active, streaming sockets that initiate connections to a server. It can be used to derive classes that implement TCP on IPv4 or IPv6.

sockpp::connector::connector ( const sock_address & addr,
std::chrono::milliseconds t )
inline

Creates the connector and attempts to connect to the specified address, with a timeout.

If the operation times out, the last_error will be set to timed_out.

Parameters

tThe duration after which to give up. Zero means never.

Member Function Documentation

◆ connect() [1/3]

result sockpp::connector::connect ( const sock_address & addr)

Attempts to connect to the specified server.

If the socket is currently connected, this will close the current connection and open the new one.

Parameters
addrThe remote server address.
Returns
The error code on failure.

◆ connect() [2/3]

template<class Rep , class Period >
result sockpp::connector::connect ( const sock_address & addr,
const duration< Rep, Period > & relTime )
inline

Attempts to connect to the specified server, with a timeout.

If the socket is currently connected, this will close the current connection and open the new one. If the operation times out, the last_error will be set to timed_out.

Parameters
addrThe remote server address.
relTimeThe duration after which to give up. Zero means never.
Returns
The error code on failure

◆ connect() [3/3]

result sockpp::connector::connect ( const sock_address & addr,
microseconds timeout )

Attempts to connect to the specified server, with a timeout.

If the socket is currently connected, this will close the current connection and open the new one. If the operation times out, the error will be errc::timed_out.

Parameters
addrThe remote server address.
timeoutThe duration after which to give up. Zero means never.
Returns
The error code on failure.
